docs.lead_paragraph: America has not one but several drug problems. That should be the first lesson of a book like the Consumers Union Report, "Licit and Illicit Drugs." One can catalogue them, as it does, by drug: Five hundred and fifty billion "doses" of nicotine smoked yearly. One estimate has it that 250,000 to 300,000 smokers die prematurely every year.

headline.main: Licit and Illicit Drugs; The American Heroin Empire

docs.abstract: Ashley, Richard: Book Heroin, by R Ashley, revd by P Steinfels and R M Veatch
